data.title: Acknowledge Sublime Text
data.body:
I love Atom, and I love that it replicates some of Sublime Text's greatest features, because as a user, I want the best possible editor and don't care where it comes from.

However, given the fact that
- Atom's command palette
- much of Atom's user interface all the way down to styles and small details (progress bar)
- some of [Atom's key bindings](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/e3641286e71447a79666682edf04570b156b67cc/keymaps/linux.cson#L16)

all seem to be ideas copied directly from Sublime, I find the fact that **Sublime Text is not mentioned _anywhere_ in the readme, the website or the documentation** (in fact, apparently not anywhere at all besides the keymap comments) quite disheartening.

I appreciate the fact that Atom and Sublime are two _very_ different editors from a technology perspective, but as far as the frontend is concerned, Atom is basically a Sublime Text clone (and has been rightfully called so in almost every article covering it). The very least GitHub can and should do is credit Sublime as an inspiration for its ideas.

data.title: open files with atom:// handler
data.body:
It should open an html handler like:
The handler opens atom, but doesn't works with params.
atom://open?url=file://Users/myuser/myapp/myfile.rb&line=32&column=12

it would be very useful for rails_panel !

data.title: Tab spacing is not absolute
data.body:
Tab spacing should be absolute, independent of any text on a given line. 
Currently, tab spacing is relative to the last 'word'. This makes it a little ridiculous to line up lines of text. As you can see, the tabs just don't like up at all.

![buggy_tabs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3362733/2905313/02474890-d604-11e3-93a9-9e73360b29f7.png)

data.title: How to uninstall in Linux?
data.body:
Hi there. Again. 

I successfully installed the program on Linux but I want to check replicability of my installation process on Ubuntu 14.04. In order to do that I need to uninstall all Atom files.  However, I don't know how to wipe them all out. 

Any suggestions?

data.title: Change syntax highlighting regardless of file format
data.body:
A big thing i've noticed from sublime text is the fact that you can open up a file and change its highlighting from its native extention to a different highlighting

It's most useful for assembly language coders as .asm is a catch all extention for assembly, yet x86 assembly and ARM assembly are completely different, more so when different compilers are involved

But i'm sure it can be used in any instance

Sublime does it with the command pallet, the user would type in 'Set Syntax <language>' and the highlighting changes to that language setting...

data.title: Project Home preference is ignored
data.body:
Atom ignores changes to `Project Home` in the core settings.
At least on :penguin: Linux it's always `$HOME`, not the specified path.

data.title: Build fails on Ubuntu 14.04 with "make: -D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE: Command not found"
data.body:
Trying to compile `atom` on a Ubuntu 14.04 64bits box, its fails with:

```
make: -D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE: Command not found
make: *** [Release/obj.target/minidump_stackwalk/deps/breakpad/src/third_party/libdisasm/ia32_implicit.o] Error 127
```

Using `g++ (Ubuntu 4.8.2-19ubuntu1) 4.8.2` and `GNU Make 3.81`.

Any idea?

data.title: Building on Mint 16 (Ubuntu 13.10)
data.body:
This thread will document the troubles and solutions to said troubles of building on Mint 16.

Make you sure you have G++ installed. Haven't looked to see if you need a C++11 compliant compiler, but you the repos should have G++4.8.1, which does support most, if not all, of C++11 (think it still needs <regex> implemented>. I'm guessing this does not require C++11 due to the use of typedefs, and the VC++2010 requirements on Windows.

The npm package out of the repos is version 1.2.x. To upgrade, all you have to do is `sudo npm install -g npm` and you'll then have 1.4.10.

Current issue: script/build fails with
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jready/Development/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/gyp/gyp_main.py", line 18, in <module>
    sys.exit(gyp.script_main())
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'script_main'
gyp ERR! configure error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: `gyp` failed with exit code: 1
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.onCpExit (/home/jready/Development/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/configure.js:340:16)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.EventEmitter.emit (events.js:98:17)
gyp ERR! stack     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:789:12)
gyp ERR! System Linux 3.11.0-12-generic
gyp ERR! command "node" "/home/jready/Development/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js" "rebuild"
gyp ERR! cwd /home/jready/Development/atom/apm/node_modules/atom-package-manager/node_modules/runas
gyp ERR! node -v v0.10.15
gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v0.13.0
gyp ERR! not ok 
npm WARN package.json github-url-from-git@1.1.1 No repository field.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jready/Development/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/gyp/gyp_main.py", line 18, in <module>
    sys.exit(gyp.script_main())
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'script_main'
gyp ERR! configure error 
gyp ERR! stack Error: `gyp` failed with exit code: 1
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.onCpExit (/home/jready/Development/atom/build/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/lib/configure.js:340:16)
gyp ERR! stack     at ChildProcess.EventEmitter.emit (events.js:98:17)
gyp ERR! stack     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:789:12)

Will be looking into this error, and will report back with what I find.

data.title: Running download-atom-shell task fails with system cannot find the path specified (Windows)
data.body:
After taking a fresh clone of the repository, I no longer have issues building ctags (#1950).

Now I am able to build the modules and de-dupe them.  Instead I'm getting this error:

```
Installing language-yaml@0.6.0 ✓
Deduping modules ✓
Running "download-atom-shell" task
>> The system cannot find the path specified.
Aborted due to warnings.
C:\atom [master]>
```

This is the contents of `atom/atom-shell`:

```
C:\atom [master]> ls atom-shell


    Directory: C:\atom\atom-shell


Mode                LastWriteTime     Length Name
----                -------------     ------ ----
d----          5/7/2014   8:55 AM            resources
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM    6439936 atom.exe
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM   44535296 chromiumcontent.dll
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM    5689000 content_shell.pak
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM     717824 ffmpegsumo.dll
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM    9956864 icudt.dll
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM     765952 libGLESv2.dll
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM       1055 LICENSE
-a---          5/7/2014   8:55 AM          7 version


C:\atom [master]>
```

If I run `atom/atom-shell/atom.exe` I get this window:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1251005/2902658/1efc5212-d5e8-11e3-97a1-1ce3a12de259.png)

I don't see a log or anything to upload, is there one I'm not seeing?

data.title: Cannot update (ReferenceError: AutoUpdater is not defined)
data.body:
When updating on OSX (while being on version 0.93) I get a popup window with the following error when the app is trying to restart itself:

```
ReferenceError: AutoUpdater is not defined
    at EventEmitter.autoUpdater.quitAndInstall     (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/auto-updater.js:32:35)
  at AutoUpdateManager.module.exports.AutoUpdateManager.install (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/auto-update-manager.js:109:26)
  at AtomApplication.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:252:39)
  at AtomApplication.EventEmitter.emit (events.js:98:17)
  at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.sendCommand (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/atom-application.js:390:22)
  at item.click (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/browser/application-menu.js:185:45)
  at MenuItem.click (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/menu-item.js:38:18)
  at delegate.executeCommand (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/menu.js:78:31)
```

Disabled packages:

```
'disabledPackages': [
    'language-objective-c'
    'archive-view'
    'metrics'
    'feedback'
    'deprecation-cop'
    'welcome'
    'markdown-preview'
    'link'
   ]
```

data.title: Events.js error, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
data.body:
Hello!
For the first, when i first tried to do, script/build, it said build/node_modules/.bin/npm did not exist. So i hardlinked (ln -s /usr/bin/npm build/node_modules/.bin/npm) npm to the directory, and it worked. I also had to comment out no-parallel option from node-gyp

But now i am stuck with another error, and can't seem to fix it:
mustafa@mustafa:~/atom$ script/build

Installing modules ✓
Deduping modules ✓

events.js:72
        throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
              ^
Error: spawn ENOENT
    at errnoException (child_process.js:998:11)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:789:34)
mustafa@mustafa:~/atom$

data.title: Default Markdown colour scheme unreadable
data.body:
![screen shot 2014-05-07 at 10 31 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/206120/2900696/a30ddb98-d5ca-11e3-9bc2-10030c30614a.png)

Steps to reproduce:
1) Download Atom.
2) Open disk image.
3) Copy application to /Applications
4) Double-click /Applications/Atom.app

You are then presented with a window appearing as in the screenshot.
Clearly (or rather, not) the majority of the text is dark grey on a black background. This is unreadable. Headers and links are mid-grey on black. Bad, but I can just about make it out. Link URLs are very dark grey on black—thus completely illegible.

So that was my first 60 seconds with your software. Let me know when you are ready to try again.

```
npm ERR!     node-gyp rebuild
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls runas
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.
npm ERR! System Linux 3.10.0-121.el7.x86_64
npm ERR! command "node" "/usr/bin/npm" "--userconfig=/home/matej/archiv/knihovna/repos/atom/.npmrc" "install" "--quiet"
npm ERR! cwd /home/matej/archiv/knihovna/repos/atom/build
npm ERR! node -v v0.10.28
npm ERR! npm -v 1.4.10
npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Additional logging details can be found in:
npm ERR!     /home/matej/archiv/knihovna/repos/atom/build/npm-debug.log
npm ERR! not ok code 0
matej@wycliff: atom (master)$ tmp /home/matej/archiv/knihovna/repos/atom/build/npm-debug.log
npm-debug.log.bz2                               100%  171KB 170.5KB/s   00:00    
http://mcepl.fedorapeople.org/tmp/npm-debug.log.bz2
matej@wycliff: atom (master)$ 
```

And no, with reference to http://discuss.atom.io/t/debian-testing-64-bit-build-report/8791/6,  python is set in `/root/.npmrc` (which is symlinked to `/etc/npmrc`, just be sure) to `/usr/bin/python2` (not sure what's the difference, because the default python here is still python 2.7).

data.title: when building atom, does it automatically pull newest atom-shell version?
data.body: If not, how do we set it up?

data.title: Cannot build atom on utunbu 14.04
data.body:
I followed the instructions on readme.md, and the when I issue:

sudo script/grunt install

I get the following error:

/usr/bin/env: node: No such file or directory
## 

$ uname -a
Linux trusty 3.13.0-24-generic #47-Ubuntu SMP Fri May 2 23:30:00 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ node -v
v0.10.26

$ npm -v
1.4.3

data.title: Autoupdater not working
data.body:
I had installed Version 0.93 of Atom and so today it was automatically downloading 0.94 since its released. After the download finished, i clicked on `Restart and Install Update` and than it crashed with this message:

![bildschirmfoto 2014-05-07 um 08 56 26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5446019/2899385/f578973a-d5b4-11e3-90ab-d980bf5e74a8.png)

Edit:

Sorry, saw that there is already an issue opened.

data.title: Add proxy settings
data.body:
Hi,

I haven't found any way to configure proxy, which makes downloading of packages impossible for me. I'm behind a proxy at my work.

Thanks!
